New Records: All 10 victories in the Cavaliers’ streak have been by double digits, a franchise record.
Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen had 19 points and 11 rebounds.
Donovan Mitchell had 17 of his 19 points in the second half.
LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller paced Charlotte with 24 points apiece.
Nick Smith Jr. had 18 points off the bench.
Cleveland began the second quarter with a 24-6 run, fueled by its two big men, to build a commanding 53-29 lead.
Mobley scored seven points and Allen had five points and four rebounds in the surge.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland has not lost since Dec. 8 at Miami.
Its lone home defeat was Nov. 27 against Atlanta.

Only four teams in NBA history have posted a better record through 35 games than the Cavaliers: Golden State (33-2) in 2015-16, Philadelphia (32-3) in 1966-67, the Los Angeles Lakers (32-3) in 1971-72 and Chicago (32-3) in 1995-96.
Others: Hornets: Ball and Miller each missed the previous three games with left ankle injuries, but came back strong and combined for 28 of Charlotte’s 48 points in the first half.
Ball is averaging 30.1 points and Miller is at 21.4.
Cavaliers: Starting small forward Isaac Okoro, who has been sidelined since Dec. 20 with a right shoulder sprain, was cleared to practice with no restrictions.
Okoro had been taking part in limited contact workouts against assistant coaches.
